text:
My Gold fish is swimming sideways and cant seem to keep up r... My Gold fish is swimming sideways and cant seem to keep up r...by Guest 6 years ago65,355My Gold fish is swimming sideways and cant seem to keep up right.
He seems to be breathing ok, but just cant keep his balance what can i do for him?
Sponsored Links
Posted on Cold Water Fish
Answer6 years ago #2Rohan
Master Blogs: 8 Forum: 3,232 Votes: 98Its because of the swim bladder problem.
One reason could be overfeeding another could be high nitrate.
DO NOT feed him the commercial food you are giving and DON"T feed him for a couple of days (4-5)Then feed him boiled non salted pea with outer cover removed by cutting in small pieces
And perform an immediate change of 50% water
Btw how big is your tank?
How often you feed and change water?
how many fishes are there in the tank ?
Reply6 years ago #3temari22Guesti got the same problem with one of my goldfishes.. she keeps swimming backwards or when shes going down at times she will swim up going backwards and sometimes she will swim up and make a quick circle backwards.
is their something wrong with me fish?
Sponsored Links
Reply6 years ago #4jen
Guest
I have 2 gold fish, both i believe are fan tails they are in a 20 gallon tank and we try to change the tank every week to every other week.
if we dont change the water fully we suction out the rocks.
It seems like his tail might be broken but he can still move it just cant keep up right.
Reply6 years ago #5Jase
Ace Blogs: 4 Forum: 1,121 Votes: 49Goldfish get quite prone to swim bladder disease or disfunctions of, and you notice this most in how they swim.
I add garden pea (defrosted if frozen) then lightly boiled, deshelled and chopped to be bite size for the size of fish you have.
Has kept my fish healthy by maintaining a balanced diet including this pea supplement, but the chopped pea may help you.
Reply6 years ago #6Rohan
Master Blogs: 8 Forum: 3,232 Votes: 98Its because of the same reasons stated above.
Try the advice given with pea Reply6 years ago #7Jen
Guest
Thank U!
i will try i hope it works ☹️Sponsored Links
Reply6 years ago #8Rohan
Master Blogs: 8 Forum: 3,232 Votes: 98Wish your fish a very good health Reply4 years ago #9Monique
Guest
Thank for the good description on how to feed the pea to your fish.
I read it elsewhere but found your explanation most helpfully and clear.
I have just descovered my fish having swimming problems so will try the pea idea.
Thanks Reply4 years ago #10nkululo
Guest
My fish tank is 10liters big, i have 4 fishes in my fish tank, i only feed my fishes in the morning
Reply4 years ago #11CMGuest
Thanks for this tip.
I found this forum a few weeks ago and followed your advice about feeding my (five year-old) goldfish peas.
She had been swimming sideways and almost looked dead, but the peas and 50/50 water change actually worked!Reply4 years ago #12tom
Guestpoor gold fish my goldfish does the same iv been wondering why he has been like it for 8 years now (he is alive and happy that is the best thing.
Sponsored Links
Reply4 years ago #13Guppies4Life
Champion Blogs: 1 Forum: 1,975 Votes: 83Hello, please do not post one old post, it pushes newer post to the bottom of the list, let alone this post has already been answered.
Please do not do this again Reply3 years ago #14Noob
Guestok how long will it last my fish started to swim side ways right now and i have school tomorrow and im worried that it will die...i have 10 fish will it spread?
Reply3 years ago #15Noob
Guestnvm its to late its dead... Reply3 years ago #16corydoraking
Platinum Member Blogs: 1 Forum: 311 Votes: 15Please do not ask questions on old posts because it bumps down newer, more relevant posts.
As for the problem I do not know try asking a direct question and not posting on old threads please.
Here on MAC the people are kind and are willing to answer your question.
Reply2 years ago #17ty
Guest9Sponsored Links
Reply2 years ago #18Jack Chessher
Master Blogs: 13 Forum: 3,563 Votes: 125Hi Ty,Can you please not respond to old threads, it causes newer and more important questions to move further down the list, if you have a question, you are free to go ahead and start a new thread in the green box, in the top-right hand corner of the site.
Jack
Reply2 years ago #19Nathan
Guest
Thank you I will try it on my gray colored gold fish named fishy also I have 2. how do I feed one and not the other Reply2 years ago #20aimee lemieux
Guestare these frozen peas that we eat?
Thank you.
Reply2 years ago #21Keyona
Guest
He isn't eating anything.
He's 1 goldfish we won at the fair.
First time owning a fish and he's in a one gallon filtered hexagon tank.
He's only swimming on one side
Reply2 years ago #22Crested
Canadians
Master Blogs: 1 Forum: 4,617 Votes: 115These guys need 75 gallons.
Or even better a pond.
Can you post pictures?
Goldfish can get upwards of 10 inches at times.
